summary: The Future Agriculture Retention and Management Act of 2025 (FARM Act of 2025) aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It restricts the application of energy tax credits for renewable energy production (solar and wind) on agricultural land when such projects are undertaken by public utilities. The bill defines "agricultural land" by referencing the Food Security Act of 1985 and defines "public utility." The amendments apply to property placed in service after the bill's enactment.
